name: Pemi Cabins

reviews.text: We have been going to the Pemi Cabins for 3 years. We love this place. Very clean. Very nice owners and staff. They treat you like family. Very easy to find and close to all the attractions.
reviews.title: Best hotel ever stayed at!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My girlfriend and I were in Lincoln for a much-needed week-long vacation in June 2011. It was one of those spur-of-the-moment things, so we didn't have time to do much research or book anything in advance. Usually we like to stay in a cabin at the Riverbank Motel, but they were booked for the entire week we were there. After passing up a few of the usual suspects (Woodward's, Indian Head, et al), we decided to stay at Pemi Cabins for a couple of nights because i) we liked the look of it from the road, and ii) it got good reviews on TripAdvisor.
reviews.title: Not great, not terrible.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent our first night in Fox, and the second in the slightly larger Bear, which gave us an opportunity to compare. Both were comfortable, if a bit small even for two people. (Fox is a 1BR, Bear a 2BR.) In both cabins the bedrooms have a full bed, chest of drawers, a rail for hanging clothes, and a deck facing the river. Both have a bathroom with sink, toilet, and shower, and a living area with futon, cable TV, mini fridge, and microwave. Bear has a wood fireplace, Fox has a gas "illusion-o-wood" stove.
reviews.title: Excellent place, great value, great service, going back ASAP

reviews.text: Our first night was quite peaceful, relaxing, and comfortable. In the morning we decided we sort of liked Pemi Cabins, and looked forward to seeing Bear, because we figured if Fox was nice then the larger Bear would be even nicer. This was sort of true, I guess, but not really. The layout was strange, the shower drain was blocked, the bathroom smelled like mold or old pee (I still can't decide), the living area was cramped, and the position of the futon made the wall-mounted TV difficult to watch. To the credit of the owners, when we notified them of the blocked drain the dude came out twice to fix it, and was very cheerful about it.
reviews.title: Best Value in the White Mountains

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One annoyance that wasn't really the owners' fault: two families staying in the adjoining cabins partied well into the night, talking loudly and blasting music from a car stereo. After a couple hours of this I thought it was weird that nobody else had complained, so we decided we'd be the first. I felt bad, because we'd obviously woken up whoever picked up the phone; on the other hand, the music didn't stop until about an hour after we called: so either the owners didn't speak to our neighbors, or they did and our neighbors ignored them...
reviews.title: Cozy, convenient and relaxing!

reviews.text: I had been staying at Pemi Cabins for 20 years. I always LOVED staying there. My husband started going there when he was kid. His whole family used to stay there. Recently, however, they have started adding so many rules that it is no longer enjoyable.
reviews.title: Too many rules and restrictions. Not a fun, easy vaca.
For the most part a great place to stay
reviews.text: We made a tradition of taking our kids up there in the winter and doing the Santa's Village trip. This year when we tried to make reservations, the week PRIOR to Thanksgiving, the automated system put up a notice stating there was a two night minimum. They never had a minimum before, so I emailed stating who I was that I have been a long time customer, etc...and since none of the cabins were booked for that night, could we work it out? The answer was no. We found other accommodations that we really enjoyed, so it worked out for us, but it was still disappointing.

When I checked their reservations on the morning we were heading up, they still had only 3 rented cabins, perhaps if they were more flexible they would have rented more. Well, atleast 1 more for sure. My husband's cousin tried to make a reservation for two nights this summer, he had been going there close to 30 years, and was told he needed to make a reservation for 3 nights. Customer loyalty just isn't a big deal for them.
reviews.title: Third year staying here and will be back again!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had no trouble with the former owners, but since the change of ownership there were a couple of instances where they messed up our reservation. We actually had to find other accomodations once we were up there, but kept going back, mostly for nastalgia.
reviews.title: Great Little place near the mountains

reviews.text: We had been talking Pemi Cabins up for years to all of our friends and sent a lot people there way, now we no longer go there. We have found new places to stay, so it worked for us, it's still a little sad that we had to break such a long tradition.
reviews.title: Super helpful staff, clean and charming cabins!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I'm not sure why this place was rated so high by so many other reviewers. All I can think of is that when you travel with pets you tend to overlook some things? We ended up here because we had planned to camp but it rained so we opted for cabins with fireplaces and kitchenettes. On the good side, the location is terrific. Right down the road from the notch and hiking but on the river which drowned out any traffic noise. Nice screened in porch and the people who run the place were really nice. But the place was run down and dirty. The mattress on the bed was shot. The carpet was dirty and smelled bad and the shower was really moldy and gross. They would need to seriously step up the cleaning routine here before I would return.
reviews.title: Great location... dirty cabins

reviews.text: This was my fourth or fifth time coming up to Pemi Cabins. What a wonderful place! The staff is always extremely friendly and will do everything possible to accomodate any and all requests. They are very knowledgable about the area and able to provide directions, ideas, and wonderful conversation. The Pemi River runs along the back of the cabins and is one of our favorite things in the summer. It's great to just get your feet wet and to sit and enjoy the tranquility of the river running through. The cabins are very country and rustic - most of them with fireplaces and screened-in porches. Some have kitchenettes while others have a microwave - so you just need to pick the cabin that fits your needs. It's a great place in the summer or winter time. Different activities for different seasons. Close to everything in Lincoln and Woodstock and are short distance to a plethora of activities and sight-seeing. Not to mention they have a wonderful gift shop! Prices are just fantastic and they haven't changed much over the years. It's one price year round. These folks really know what they are doing and are some of the most pleasant folks we've encountered.
reviews.title: Wonderful place in the heart of the White Mountains

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Driving through Lincoln NH we saw a bunch of different places to say, but luckily when we arrived at the cabins we realized that we had found the gem of the town!! When we went to check in I fell in love with even that little building. Knick-knacks everywhere with a really country and woodsy feel. I bought a beautiful canvas and little wood saying in there! When I ran into the cabin to see it cause I was so excited I was immediately pleased. The cabin not only was clean but it smelt SO good. You would think that little cabins like that may smell musty, but it had a vanilla/clean smell. I loved the living area with the gas stove that was very easy to control and worked so well to keep it warm when it got a little chilly outside at night. The bedroom and bathroom were perfect for two people in the cabin we were in. The back screened-in porch is connected to the bedroom and when you're on the porch you are directly above the beautiful flowing river :) We had the windows open even when it was closed at night because it was SO peaceful to hear while we were sleeping!! We used the grills to cook lunch and dinner the second day we were there and they worked out perfectly. It is mandatory to recycle in the cabins, so that is a wonderful bonus for anyone who appreciates the earth! Unfortunately, we only stayed for two nights so we weren't there for too too long, but the two nights and three days we did get to spend there were magical. We didn't even want to go around the town because our cabin was just so relaxing and perfect. CANNOT WAIT to go back this winter!!! GREAT JOB to the Caston's!! THANK YOU!
reviews.title: AMAZING! Can't wait to see it in the winter!

reviews.text: The cabins are great, clean, spacious. the location is fabulous just over the river. the service is welcoming and homely. The recycling instructions are a bit harsh anf frightening... wish we could just live here.
reviews.title: great place, beautiful location

reviews.text: Great place, friendly staff, perfect location, reasonable prices & best of all pet friendly!!!! :)
reviews.title: We love this place!!! Great for dog owners you hate to board there dogs. :)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife, dog, and I spent a week at Pemi Cabins recently, primarily to hike in the nearby mountains. We were very pleased with the accommodations and the friendliness of the staff. We stayed in one of the attached motel rooms, not the cabins, however the room was perfect for what we needed. The room was small, but we did not need much space since we were out most of the day. The location is perfect for hiking and for convenience as it is a short trip to Franconia Notch and the town of Lincoln. The only complaint we had was that the wifi did not work well (reason for 4 not 5 stars). We would definitely stay again and highly recommend the place!
reviews.title: Perfect Place to Stay for a Hiking Vacation

reviews.text: Pemi Cabins is a nice place to stay in a very nice area.
reviews.title: Nice place. Nice people.

reviews.text: I didn't rent a cabin, I opted for a room, which was clean, quiet and comfortable.
reviews.title: we loved our stay and well keep coming back

reviews.text: The staff were very friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: I LOVE this place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would definitely stay here again and recommend Pemi to friends.
reviews.title: Heavenly Cabins!! Great Location!!

description: Rustic and inviting 1 & 2 bedroom cabins nestled on the bank of the Pemigewasset River. We offer cozy fireplaces, complimentary coffee, 14 channels of HBO & Wi-Fi. Our screen porches overlook the river and several cabins have kitchens. We are open year round and are pet friendly.
